Your head was swimming as you surveyed the room. Cold, dingy tiles stretched out in all directions, the perspective rapidly stretching around you as you felt your clothing getting baggy, heavy. Your head was pounding as you found yourself looking up at the smug fox who leaned against the wall, his slender arms folded over his chest as his bushy tail flicked in time with the music that thumped in under the restroom door.

"Wellwell. Looks like someone slipped you an extra somethin' somethin' in your drink. You really gotta be careful about stuff like that in a dive like this. You'd be in trouble if I were the shady type." A slightly too-toothy grin split the fox's slender muzzle as he glided over to wash his hands at the sink, having to rise onto his toes to reach the slightly too-high fixtures. "Lucky for you, little man, I'm an officer of the law. Protect and serve and all that stuff, right?"

You shook your head slowly, trying to clear it as the fox wiped his damp hands off on his rumpled, lime green shirt, planting his hands on his knees as he stooped to look down at you. The pile of clothes around you seemed to be growing still, that gold neck-chain you were wearing moments ago keeping your arms pinned to your side, effectively trapping you as the fox winks.

"Don't worry. I'll take good care of you. . . once you're done shrinking. I mean, I don't need any of that wiped off on me, I'm short as it is."

"Okay, look, I gotta be honest, man. I've seen a lot of things, but I've never seen a thing like you. But I know that you're not in a good place to be all tiny and vulnerable. So I'm gonna take you home with me and we'll figure out what to do from there, alright?"

It's only from the sudden increase in volume of the thunderously loud music in the bar that you can tell he's left the bathroom, a short exchange of voices overhead, apparent pleasantries you can't quite make out over the din and through the muffling of the fabric that's holding you snug.

As Nick steps outside into the cool night air, the din of the bar fading none too soon, your ears still ringing from the experience, his paws crunch in the gravel as he crosses the parking lot to his car, only the fox's body-heat keeping you warm as you notice you're beginning to see your own breath, his every footstep jostling another jagged breath out of you as you're bounced about in his pocket.

"I gotta tell you, squeaker, I didn't think I'd make it out of there unnoticed with all your stuff. That's a relief. I don't wanna have to share my new toy in a predator's bar." You slowly started to open your eyes only to see that you were underneath a table that had a white tablecloth over it. And when you poked your head out from underneath you quickly realized that everything in the room you were in was huge. Or at least that's what you thought was the case until you saw off in the distance giant sized characters from the movie Zootopia to which you realized that you had actually somehow shrunk to about eight inches in height. You took in a breathe of air to calm yourself down as you said out loud to yourself, "Okay, I have no idea what's going on here. But I better find someone who could help me. Or at the very least keep me safe while I'm here."

Upon saying this you saw off in the distance Nick Wilde, who was currently wearing his police uniform. By the look on his face he seemed to be enjoying himself, although he did look pretty tired too. You then looked to your right and saw another fox off in the distance other unlike having a slender and fit build like Nick this anthro fox had a bit of a gut on him which you knew meant that it was none other then Gideon Grey. You figured that he could probably help you in same way since you knew that he was a baker once he had changed his ways. And it looked like he was still wearing his apron over his clothes meaning that he must have brought some pies to the party. Then finally you saw a very well muscled black jaguar who was wearing his chaffeur uniform. And you had to be honest to yourself since you couldn't help but notice how tight the clothes looked against his large muscles. But once you had gotten rid of thoughts you knew that he would most likely keep you safe from harm since he also seemed like a nice guy.

"Hmm, alright so I have three choices of guys that I could try to ask for help from. And I know from the movie that all three of them would be nice and caring that I'm sure. But now the question is who do I go to?" You asked yourself, as you placed your right hand underneath your chin for a moment.

But after you gave it some thought you deiced that it would be in your best option to go towards....
11333.title: at a party

113332.content: You took one last look over at Nick and decided that it would be to not bother him since he looked really tired. And so that just left you with either asking help from Gideon Grey or Renato Manchas. So the question was who did you try to go and get the attention of?
113332.title: Gideon or Manchas.

You found your eyes widening in shock upon seeing a giant sized Fox McCloud only a few feet ahead of you. However, once the hock factor had subsided you quickly realized that Fox wasn't giant, you were just really small. In fact by the looks of it you had to guess your current height was five inches in height. However, you knew that you had to get the anthro mercenary's attention since he was considered a hero in his world. So there's no way he wouldn't be willing to you after you explained the situation to him....or at least the details that you DID know about since you still weren't sure how you got here or how you had shrunk.

And so you knew what you had to do as you made your way to the light brown and cream furred fox and called out, "Excuse me, Fox. I need your help."

You saw the giant anthro fox's right ear twitch a little while he looked around and asked, "Hmm? Did someone just ask for my help?"

"Yes, down here!" You shouted, hope clear in your voice.

1323.content:
You couldn't believe what you were seeing. Standing off a good feet away from you was none other then Rocket Raccoon in trademark orange and black attire. However, by how big he looked he had to assume that you were only one inch in height. And even though you knew Rocket did have an attitude, but you figured that maybe you could convince him to help you. Or at the very least keep you safe while you were with him.

And so with those thoughts clear in your mind you made your way towards him as you called out, "Excuse me, but are you Rocket Raccoon, one of the Guardians of the Galaxy?"

"Yeah, so who's asking?....." Rocket sap out, before you saw his red eyes look around before they looked down at you. Once this happened you saw a look of confusion on his when he added, "Oh hey look another human just like Quill. But wait a minute....aren't you suppose to be ya know taller being a human and all that junk."

"Yes, I am suppose to be taller. But somehow I ended up just waking up being at this size." You explained, before you saw the anthro like raccoon lower a hand for you to get on. After you did this you continued with, "But when I saw you, I figured that you could help out somehow...if you weren't that busy that is."

Upon finishing those words you were brought up to the raccoon's face as you saw him look from the left and then right side of the room before he looked back at you and had decided to....
1323.title: Rocket Raccoon

choices: Rocket carries you to the lab, he needs to understand why you're so small.
Rocket brings you to Cosmo.  If anyone can fix your memory, it's that mutt.
Rocket may have had a LITTLE too much to drink and goes straight to his room.
13232.content:
The raccoon laughed as he bobbled you in a paw, watching you helplessly skid across the leather of his palm as he made his way across the ship's galley to pour himself a drink, the shimmering blue liquid splashing over the lip of the cup as he tries to manage this one handed, not quite wanting to put his find down yet.

As he sipped his drink his thumb brushed against your face, a smile turning up the corner of his mouth as he looked down at you, his ears perking as he mulled over what to do with you.

"So, human. . . " He started, shushing you as you try to interject. "Nono. Your name is 'human' now. I have to remember enough stupid names with Peter. He calls himself Starlord, can you believe that shit? What kinda person thinks they can lord over the stars. He can barely pilot this pile of scrap."

The raccoon laughs at his own joke, liquor splashing over the edge of the cup and onto you as he gestures wildly around with the glass.

"Anyways. Like I was saying, Human. I gotta be honest, I just figured you were some new pet that Groot found or something. Mostly cuz every human I've ever met is a LOT taller than me. . . except Lang. He was fun." The raccoon smirks again, slamming the rest of his drink before slamming the cup down, the sweet scent of his breath now washing over you as he leans in close. "I figure we should run some tests, figure out exactly how you landed in my ship and why you're so small. Cuz, right now, you're a mystery and I don't like that. So when I say 'hop' you make like a goddamn flea, got it? I don't have time to explain everything to you."

You nodded absently to the raccoon, trying to take in all this, even as his thumb brushed against your face again, wiping the hair away from your eyes. "Th-thank you, sir. You won't regret this."

"Ah, that's where you're wrong. I already do. But I figure we can at least try to make it as un-miserable as possible while I'm stuck with you." With that, he winks, depositing you in the now-empty, though still slightly sticky, cup.
13232.title: have a drink with you in hand.

choices: Cranked to 11, you're cut off.  And begin shrinking!

This is too risky!  Let's see what else we can discover first.
132321.content:
"Home sweet home. Make yourself comfortable, Human." The raccoon chuckled under his breath as he slid into his 'lab', what was likely once a spare bedroom in the underbelly of the Guardian's ship. Numerous half-assembled monitors hung over his work bench, a stream of impossible to follow data and images cascading across the flickering surfaces as the raccoon settled onto his stool.

With a crooked grin, he used one arm to brush aside the myriad tools and the unfeasilbly oversized weapon he had apparently been modifying before he happened upon you. "Now, let's fire up the spectral analyzer and see exactly what kind of nonsense was left lingering in your DNA."

You nodded slowly, watching intently as the racccoon moved several machines around, several strange lights now shining down on you from above as you self-conciously covered yourself with both hands, once you realized your nude form was being shown on the various monitors. With a squeak, you called up to your host, the sticky sweet scent of whatever he'd been drinking making your head swim, as the glass trembled slightly with every thud of the bass from the song booming out of the speakers on the desk.

Was that Aerosmith? God, it was hard to tell at this size. Everything sounded so loud, so distorted.

"You even listenin' Human?"

The direct question snapped you back to attention, your gaze snapping back upwards to look at the raccoon's looming face. "Guh. Sorry. I think the liquor is . . uhm. . . "

"Yeah. I can see your vitals. You're a liiiiiiittle blitzed. I hadn't considered you bein' such a lightweight. Peter's a much better drinking partner." The raccoon smirked as he pivoted one of the screens in your direction, an incomprehensible jumble of numbers and letters that weren't quite english. "You're also just SWIMMING in exotic particles and all but vibrating, trying to blip right out of phase. I think you're only hanging in this universe by a thread, if I'm reading this right. Dimensional folding like this doesn't happen often, but I can probably modulate the ship's force field to cut the particle flow. Probably. Looks like I have two options; I can either try and draw the particle flow this way by reversing the sheild's wave front or crank that baby up to 11 and see if it snaps you back home."

Your brow furrows as you try to parse what he's saying, the combination of the alcohol and advanced particle physics sending the topic, quite literally right over your head.

Still, the raccoon is looking at you, patiently awaiting your response, while you stand ankle deep in that droplet of shimmering, glowing blue booze.

"Let's try reversing the flow of the particles." You told Rocket to which you saw him nod his in understanding.

You then heard him mess with some things before he replied, "Alright, then let's get this started."

After he had uttered those words you heard him flip a lever to which you soon realized that nothing was happening. Or at least nothing was happening to you. Because before you knew it you heard Rocket curse very loudly when you heard the sound of various things being borken. This caused you to become worried as you yelled out to him, "Rocket? ARe you okay?"

"I hate to tell you this human, but NO I"M NOT OKAY!" The raccoon shouted very loudly, while you felt the cup being moved. Once this happened you heard his voice again when he added with both frustration and concern, "But don't worry I can fix this. So do you DARE move from that cup. Because the last thing I need is for you get to hurt."

Hearing this prompted you to let out a heavy sigh as you knew that staying where you were was obviously the best option even though you wished you could help in some way. Before long though you heard Rocket let out his own sigh this being one of relief when you heard the sound of a lever being pulled again. Once this happened you saw two fingers from one of his hands before they gently removed you from within the cup in had been in. You were then set down onto the other hand of Rocket's to which you quickly realized that something was wrong since his hand looked bigger then what it had been earlier. But upon looking over him you saw nothing but a large and well muscled chest rise and fall from his breathing. This prompted you to let out a gasp of shock as you looked up and down his body and saw that the guardian had grown in height and had somehow gained the muscles close to that of a bodybuilder.

But as you looked over the raccoon's new body you asked him, "Rocket, what happened?"

"Heck if I know. All I did was set the necessary settings before reversing the flow of the particles. But I guess that wasn't a smart idea since I wasn't expecting to be the one who was going to be growing. Because to be honest I was hoping that reversing the particles would either grow you a little or a least get you back home." Rocket explained, before you heard him clear his throat. Doing this caused you to look away from his soft member and balls that you had found yourself staring at. And when you looked back up at his face he continued with, "Hey human, I know that I look amazing now. But let's try to keep our eyes up here with mine if you can huh?"

13232121.content:
You gasped a little at Rocket's answer. Looking around the palm you sat in you saw the brown fur expand for yards. If you could guess, your body would be equivalent to the size of a pea to Rocket.

"Wow...Rocket your body it's....amazing", you stuttered out as you gazed at the strong chest of the raccoon. Rocket let out a dry chuckle.

You took a deep breath before you looked up at Rocket and told him, "I think you should put me between your pecs. This way you can get me out without much trouble once you've gotten to your room."

13232122.content:
Hearing that Rocket had grown six more feet in height caused you to look up at him in utter shock as you remarked, "Holy cow, you're now ten feet tall."

"Yup, and now I guess I'm going to have to make a new lab either in the engine room or in a part of my room since I broke all of my equipment." The now large muscled raccoon replied, followed by letting out a tired sigh. Once he did this though you saw him look back down at you when he added, "But I guess something like that can't be helped now. Although now I had better hide you before I try to head back to my room. Because the last thing I need is one of the other Guardians seeing me before I can find some new clothes to wear. Or find you for that matter too."

"Okay then where you were thinking of hiding me exactly?" You asked, as a grin spread across the anthro like raccoon's muzzle.

You were then lifted up to the huge chest of the furry Guardian before he pushed you into the space that was in-between his pectorals. This led you to see nothing but his dark brown colored fur which was hard due to the fact that his chest was blocking out the light from the outside world. You then heard him let out a light chuckle as he began to crawl out of his ruined lab and said, "There. Did that answer your question, Human. I hope you enjoy being between my pecs until I get to my room. Don't worry though maybe if we have time you and I can have some fun checking out my improved body together."

After he had said this you felt the space you were in get a little bit tighter to which you assumed wasRcoket's way to make sure you stayed where he had placed you. You then could feel small vibrations which were caused the raccoon's footsteps as you wondered would Rocket be able to get to his room without any problems? Or would the other Guardians see him and then question him on what happened to which he would have some explaining to do?
13232122.title: A Ten Foot Tall Raccoon On The Loose

132321221.content:

info.brief_description: This story is about vore and everything else related to being shrunk.
info.description:
Falling into the hands of someone in a strange land, what will happen when anything goes?


Feel free to add content! It's open to pretty much anything, though there are just a few rules:

1. Try to keep the interactions to male/male.

2. No death, and therefore, no hard vore, digestion, scat, etc.

3. All types of vore (besides hard) are allowed.

4. Keep new character additions reasonable; avoid OCs.

5. Entries will be edited, but just for spelling or grammar, not content.

6. No endings, keep the story going.

7. Have fun, this is an open interactive story!

Note: I realize that the first chapter isn't the most creative, but that's not why you read these stories, so I just wanted to write something short to get right into it.


Thanks for reading! I hope you like it and add to it, reviews are welcome!
